First off, let me say that I am not a big supporter of RAR files. However to answer your question why they are used. Yes it is a compression file system, but that is not why it is commonly used on TPB. It is used on here because of its amazing ability to use a file recovery algorithim that is capable of keeping large files intact when transfering over "not so perfect" methods of file sharing, or very long distances such as Torrent sites. By creating "multi micro versions" of itself, there is less chance of the file being corrupted, missing data, or simply tampered with via free agent spyware. SO, as much as we hate RAR files, they actually do perform a much needed service sometimes. Then again, some uploaders should be more selective of when they use it. It isnt needed for every file you upload. Educate yourself uploaders and downloaders alike. LONG LIVE THE PIRATE BAY!!!!!
